forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely and areas of fog before 1pm, then areas of fog and a chance of rain showers. Cloudy, with a high near 71. East wind 7 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog and a slight chance of rain showers. Cloudy, with a low around 64. Northeast wind 2 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Boston, a thick, enveloping fog has settled over the city, lending a mysterious veiling to familiar sights. The air feels heavy with the scent of damp earth, a promise of rain lingering in the atmosphere. Temperatures hover around a soft 71 degrees, with east winds brushing through at a gentle pace, though they seem more like whispers than gusts. The forecast predicts a good chance for more rain this afternoon, as scattered showers teeter on the edge of possibility. A jacket might be advisable for those venturing outside, perhaps one made of water-resistant material to fend off the occasional dampness.

As evening approaches, the clouds deepen, lowering the horizon into shades of gray. A slight chance of rain remains as night settles, with temperatures easing to a warm 64 degrees. While outdoor activities might not hold their usual appeal, it could be an ideal time to peruse a local café or settle into the cozy embrace of a favorite bookstore, indulging in literature as the world outside dims into twilight. The gentle embrace of the fog creates an atmosphere perfect for contemplation or quiet conversation, as a soothing backdrop to the day's closing notes.
